result.execSummary:
The defendant Logan B Steinbach was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: By Atty Barb Privat

1:15 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Privat has received a copy of the revocation packet, with no corrections, additions or deletions.  State has received a copy of the revocation packet with no corrections, additions or deletions.  ADA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing argument by ADA.  Sentencing argument by Atty Privat.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

Count 1 - 3 months county jail
Count 2 - 3 months county jail - consecutive to each other.

Court grants 118 days of sentence credit.
Huber and to commence immediately.

Court orders the costs of $460.07 and restitution of $70.70 joint & several on count 1 and costs of $443.00 on count 2 be reduced to civil judgments.

Court adjourned at 1:19 p.m.
Sentencing hearing on revocation at 07-14-2015 01:00 pm

No Contact provision of bond has been cancelled.
43

11:23 a.m.  State by ADA Lisa Vanden Branden.  Defendant present with Attorney Jeffrey Haase.

ADA recites agreement - moves to amend count 1 to PTAC of criminal trespasss to dwelling in violation of 943.14 (M-A) and plea to count 2, as charged.  Requests restitution of $70.70.  Attorney Haase concurs.  Defendant concurs.  ADA confirms compliance with any victim/witness rights.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - waived.  Court goes over the elements of each offense and as PTAC on each count.  Court instructs regarding the maximum penalties.  Court instructs regarding deportation.  

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST to both counts.  Court finds each plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently, and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support each plea.  Court finds the defendant to the amended charge on count 1 and to count 2 - orders a judgment of conviction be entered today.  Sentencing argument by ADA.  Sentencing argument by Attorney Haase - requests expungement.  No statement by the defendant.  

Each count - Court orders SWD and places the defendant on probation for 2 years.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
Both counts -
Pay court costs.
NO contact with the victims.  Court instructs regarding the forms of no contact.
Pay restitution in the amount of $70.70 - which is to be joint and several with any co-defendants.
Obtain a high school diploma or equivalency.

Count 1
Serve 10 days county jail - with huber - complete within the next 60 days.

Court would allow expungement upon successful completion of probation.

Court adjourned at 11:35 a.m.
from Atty Jeffrey Haase - requests the status hearing be scheduled for a plea & sentencing
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 29, 2014 at 11:00 am.
Status hearing on July 15, 2014 at 10:30 am.

2:25 p.m.  State by ADA Lisa Vanden Branden.  Defendant present with Attorney Jeffrey Haase.

Statement by Attorney Haase - has received discovery - requests another status hearing be scheduled.  Court will so schedule.

Court adjourned at 2:26 p.m.
State's
Status hearing on June 3, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

3:24 p.m.  State by ADA Lisa Vanden Branden.  Defendant present with Attorney Jeffrey Haase.

Attorney Haase waives preliminary hearing on behalf of the defendant - defendant concurs.  Court instructs defendant of his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives this right.  Court accepts the waiver and binds the defendant over for trial.

ADA files an Information with the court and provides a copy to Attorney Haase.  Attorney Haase confirms receipt of the Information - waives reading.  Court makes statement regarding the maximum penalties.  Attorney Hasse indicates the defendant stands mute.  Court enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant to both counts.

Court directs Status Hearing be held in approximately thirty days.

Court adjourned at 3:27 p.m.

3:17 p.m.  State by ADA Lisa Vanden Branden.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Jeffrey Haase present on behalf of the defendant.

Statement by Attorney Haase - needs to do a waiver of the preliminary hearing - expected the defendant to have appeared in court today.  

Court directs case be set for Waiver of Preliminary Hearing to be held in approximately thirty days.

Court adjourned at 3:18 p.m.
Summary of Restitution w/attachments - $70.70
By Atty Jeffrey Haase
Status hearing on April 29, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Per Deb at PD's office, Atty Jeffrey Haase has been appointed to represent the defendant.
43
Status hearing on March 25, 2014 at 09:15 am.

Defendant is to have NO contact with William B. (victim) or the co-defendant (Justin Hernandez).    Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.

Defendant is to have NO contact with William B. (victim) or the co-defendant (Justin Hernandez).    Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.

3:07 p.m.  State by ADA Lisa Vanden Branden.  Defendant present and in custody and via video from Green Lake County Jail with Attorney Reisha Mitchell.

Attorney Mitchell confirms receipt of the complaint - waives reading - requests a preliminary hearing.  Court instructs regarding the maximum penalties - PTAC.  Court finds probable cause.

Court orders bond set at $2,000 signature bond with the conditions of:  NO contact with William B. (victim) or the co-defendant (Justin Hernandez).    Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.

Attorney Mitchell waives the time limits as to the preliminary hearing.  Court directs Status Hearing be scheduled, regarding counsel, be held in approximately two weeks.

Court adjourned at 3:11 p.m.
